questions.question_text: Which management product is used to record relationships between specialist products?

discussion.content:
Why the other options are incorrect:
A. Change Control Approach
This describes how changes to the project’s products will be managed but does not record relationships between products.

C. Issue Register
The Issue Register logs and tracks issues that arise during the project. It does not capture information about product relationships.

D. Product Status Account
This is a snapshot of the status of products at a specific point in time but does not focus on recording or managing the relationships between products.

questions.question_text: Which is a minimum requirement for applying the ‘change’ theme?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Definitely A.

I think Examcollectorthanos is just pasting AI answers, which are not always correct.

B is correct; Why other options are not minimum requirements:

A. Specify in the change control approach the means by which project products will be protected: While important, this is not the most fundamental requirement for the change theme.
C. Produce issue reports to document the impact assessment for requests for change: Issue reports can be useful, but they are not the minimum requirement for applying the change theme.
D. Delegate the change authority to the senior supplier(s) for supplier off-specifications: While delegation is possible, it's not a minimum requirement.
I think it is A

choices.D: Delegate the change authority to the senior supplier(s) for supplier off-specifications
choices.B: Document the format and contents of the issue register
choices.C: Produce issue reports to document the impact assessment for requests for change
choices.A: Specify in the change control approach the means by which project products will be protected

choices.D: Determine the initial priority of the issue that has been raised
choices.B: Gain project board feedback on the issue priority
choices.C: Consider the impact of alternative options for resolution
choices.A: Create an exception plan for project board approval

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is:
C. Consider the impact of alternative options for resolution

Explanation:
During the 'assessing issues' step in PRINCE2, the project manager evaluates the issue in detail to understand its potential impact on the project. This includes considering alternative options for resolution and their effects on project scope, time, cost, quality, risk, and benefits. Once the assessment is complete, the project manager can recommend an appropriate course of action.

Selected Answer: C
C. Consider the impact of alternative options for resolution

In this step, the project manager assesses the issue and considers various options to resolve it, including evaluating their potential impacts on the project’s scope, cost, quality, and schedule. This ensures that the best resolution approach is chosen before escalating or taking further actions.

C is correct; Why other options are not the primary focus of this step:

A. Create an exception plan for project board approval: Exception plans are created when tolerances are exceeded, not for every issue.
B. Gain project board feedback on the issue priority: While the project board might be consulted, the project manager is responsible for the initial assessment.
D. Determine the initial priority of the issue that has been raised: This is usually done when the issue is first identified, before the detailed assessment.
Option B is correct as per the contents in Prince2 6th Edition pocket Guide

D
11.4.2 Assessing issues
It may be necessary to request advice from the project board to check its understanding of the issue’s priority
or severity before proposing resolutions

questions.question_text: Which action should the project manager take during the ‘assessing issues’ step?

discussion.content:
B is correct; Why other options are not minimum requirements:

A. A project plan: While a project plan is important, it's not the specific control mechanism for managing progress.
C. An issue register: This is used to record and track issues, but it's not the primary control for managing progress against tolerances.
D. Highlight reports: These are used to communicate progress to the project board, but they are not the control mechanism itself.

Selected Answer: B
In PRINCE2, the 'progress' theme requires setting and managing tolerances as a minimum control to ensure the project stays within defined limits. Tolerances provide boundaries for time, cost, quality, scope, risk, and benefits, and enable the Project Board and other stakeholders to monitor the project’s progress without intervening unless these limits are exceeded. This control allows the Project Manager to manage day-to-day progress while keeping the Project Board informed about any deviations.

Selected Answer: B
B. Tolerances

In PRINCE2, tolerances are essential for managing progress. They define the permissible limits for deviations from the project's plan and are used to monitor and control performance. Tolerances help determine when an issue should be escalated to the next level of management if deviations exceed the allowed limits. This allows for effective management of progress and ensures that the project remains on track.

Selected Answer: B
B. 

To be following PRINCE2, a project must, as a minimum:

•define its approach to controlling progress in the PID

•be managed by stages (PRINCE2’s manage by stages principle)

•set tolerances and be managed by exception against them (PRINCE2’s manage by exception principle)

•review the business justification when exceptions are raised (PRINCE2’s continued business justification principle)

•learn lessons (PRINCE2’s learn from experience principle).

Selected Answer: D
Tolerances is not a control

questions.question_text: Which control must be used as a minimum requirement for applying the ‘progress’ theme?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The Progress theme focuses on monitoring and controlling project performance, ensuring that it stays within agreed tolerances (such as time, cost, and quality), and forecasting future performance to ensure that the project can achieve its objectives and remain viable.

Selected Answer: D
The 'Progress' theme in PRINCE2 provides mechanisms to control the project against baselines by monitoring and forecasting the project's objectives and continued viability. This theme enables the project team to evaluate current performance, assess future projections, and determine whether the project remains viable and aligned with its objectives. Through progress reports, stages, and tolerances, the Project Board and Project Manager can make informed decisions about the project's future.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
The correct answer is Option D. Progress theme contents are pretty clearly articulated

The purpose of the progress theme is to establish mechanisms to monitor and compare actual
achievements against those planned, provide a forecast for the project objectives and the project’s
continued viability, and control any unacceptable deviations.

D
12.1 The progress theme

Selected Answer: A
Should be A

questions.question_text: Which theme establishes the mechanisms to control against baselines by providing a forecast for the project’s objectives and continued viability?
